intro: Amsinckia densirugosa, commonly known as the woolly sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense, woolly covering of hairs on its stems and leaves, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert and chaparral habitats. Amsinckia densirugosa is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
